Completion of Minimum University Require: Minimum 120 credits and minimum GPA of 2.0
Completion of 45 upper-level credits, residence requirement, Writing Intensive requirement, and General Education requirement

Major Requirements: Minimum grade of 'C' in courses applied to the major
Students complete a minimum of one of the following concentrations: Applied Linguistics, Language and Literary Studies, French, German, Russian, Spanish

Complete the following, including MLL 23: MLL 190 - The World of Language: Structural and Biological Aspects (3)
MLL 301 - Textual Analysis: Words, Images, Music (3)

Concentrations (39-43 credits): Complete one of the following concentrations:
Applied Linguistics: The Applied Linguistics concentration consists of 39 credits, which includes the Modern Languages and Linguistics Core.

Complete the following:: or LING 490 - Seminar in Applied Linguistics (3)

Linguistics Electives: Complete 12 credits from upper-level LING courses or other approved courses, including a minimum of 3 credits at the 400 level.
Language and Literary Studies: The Language and Literary Studies concentration consists of 39 credits, which includes the Modern Languages and Linguistics Core. Students choose courses in consultation with a department advisor.

Complete the following:: LING 191 - The World of Language: Cultural and Social Aspects (3)

Upper-Level Courses: Complete 12 credits from upper-level courses in one modern language other than English, e.g., Arabic, Chinese, French, German, Japanese, Korean, Russian, or Spanish.
Language and Literary Studies Electives: Complete 15 credits from LING or language courses, or other courses as approved, including a minimum of 9 upper-level credits.
French Interconnections with the World: The French concentration consists of 42 credits, which includes the Modern Languages and Linguistics Core.

Complete the following:: FREN 320 - Interconnections: Trade, Technology, and Globalization (3)
FREN 330 - Interconnections: Ideas, Literature and the Arts (3)
FREN 340 - Interconnections: Social and Historical Confluences (3)

French Electives: Complete 12 credits in upper-level French courses, including a minimum of 6 credits at the 400 level.
German: The German concentration consists of 40 credits, which includes the Modern Languages and Linguistics Core. Students may select a track in cultural studies or advanced language studies.

Complete the following:: GERM 202 - Gateway to Advanced German Studies (4)
GERM 401 - German then and now: Studies in German Language (3)

Track: Complete one of the following options:

Complete the following:: GERM 375 - Germany Then and Now: Explorations of German Cultural and Intellectual History (3)
GERM 481 - Seminar in Intercultural German Studies (3)
GERM 310 - Advanced Grammar and Style in Context (3)
GERM 420 - German Culture in Global Context (3)

German Electives: Complete 6 credits from upper-level GERM courses or other approved courses, including a maximum of one course from MLL or a discipline outside of MLLI.
Russian: The Russian concentration consists of 40 credits, which includes the Modern Languages and Linguistics Core.
Russian Electives: Complete 9 credits from upper-level RUSS courses, including a maximum of 3 credits from MLL 360.
Spanish: The Spanish concentration consists of 43 credits, which includes the Modern Languages and Linguistics Core.

Complete the following:: SPAN 307 - España y sus Culturas I (3)
SPAN 308 - Latinoamérica y sus Culturas I (3)
SPAN 311 - España y sus Culturas II (3)
SPAN 312 - Latinoamérica y sus Culturas II (3)

Spanish Electives: Complete 6 credits from additional upper-level Spanish courses.
Accelerated Bachelor's/Master's Programs: Qualified students may apply to an accelerated program, which allows them to share courses between a bachelor's degree and a master's degree. Students take graduate courses as undergraduate students and later apply those courses to master's degrees. An undergraduate may apply to participate in an accelerated program even if the desired graduate program is in a department other than the one in which the student is majoring. More information is available from the Graduate School website: https://gradschool.umbc.edu/admissions/nontraditional/accelerated/
